bill.title: Senate Substitute for HB 2183 by Committee on Federal and State Affairs - Creating the transparency in revenues underwriting elections act; prohibiting the receipt and expenditure of private moneys by election officials; directing the secretary of state to publish certain registered voter totals; relating to advance voting ballots by requiring signed statements for delivery of such ballots on behalf of a voter; limiting the number of such ballots that can be delivered; prohibiting the altering or backdating of the mailing date on such ballots; requiring a matching signature on such ballots; removing the secretary of state's authority to provide additional time for receipt of such ballots; prohibiting candidates for office from engaging in certain conduct related to advance voting ballots; creating the crime of false representation of an election official; and, expanding the crime of electioneering.
bill.description: Senate Substitute for HB 2183 by Committee on Federal and State Affairs - Creating the transparency in revenues underwriting elections act; prohibiting the receipt and expenditure of private moneys by election officials; directing the secretary of state to publish certain registered voter totals; relating to advance voting ballots by requiring signed statements for delivery of such ballots on behalf of a voter; limiting the number of such ballots that can be delivered; prohibiting the altering or backdating of the mailing date on such ballots; requiring a matching signature on such ballots; removing the secretary of state's authority to provide additional time for receipt of such ballots; prohibiting candidates for office from engaging in certain conduct related to advance voting ballots; creating the crime of false representation of an election official; and, expanding the crime of electioneering.

history.action: House Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Elections
House Hearing: Tuesday, February 2, 2021, 3:30 PM Room 218-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Elections
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 84 Nay: 39
House Engrossed on Wednesday, March 3, 2021
Senate Received and Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Federal and State Affairs
Senate Hearing: Wednesday, March 24, 2021, 10:30 AM Room 144-S
Senate Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Federal and State Affairs
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Holland
Senate  Senator Hilderbrand raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled not germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Ware
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Ware was rejected  Yea: 11 Nay: 25
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Corson
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Corson was rejected  Yea: 11 Nay: 25
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Corson
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Corson was rejected
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Tyson
Senate  Senator Pettey raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Tyson was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Tyson
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Tyson was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Substitute bill be passed as amended
Senate Emergency Final Action - Substitute passed as amended;  Yea: 28 Nay: 12
House Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Representative Carpenter, B. , Representative Bergquist and Representative Miller as conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Alley,  Senator Hilderbrand and  Senator Faust-Goudeau appointed as conferees
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator Alley,  Senator Hilderbrand and  Senator Faust-Goudeau appointed as second conferees
House Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Carpenter, B.,  Representative Bergquist and  Representative Miller appointed as second conferees
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 27 Nay: 11
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 80 Nay: 42
House Reengrossed on Saturday, April 10, 2021
House Enrolled and presented to Governor on Friday, April 16, 2021
House Vetoed by Governor; Returned to House on Friday, April 23, 2021
House Motion to override veto prevailed;  Yea: 85 Nay: 38
Senate Motion to override veto prevailed;  Yea: 28 Nay: 12

votes.desc: House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 84 Nay: 39
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Ware was rejected - Yea: 11 Nay: 25
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Corson was rejected - Yea: 11 Nay: 25
Senate Emergency Final Action - Substitute passed as amended - Yea: 28 Nay: 12
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 27 Nay: 11
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 80 Nay: 42
House Motion to override veto prevailed - Yea: 85 Nay: 38
Senate Motion to override veto prevailed - Yea: 28 Nay: 12
